intro: Fibraurea trotteri, commonly known as the yellowwood tree, is a species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, yellowish bark and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant is evergreen and can grow up to 15 meters in height, often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are attractive to birds and other wildlife.
